pageContext.claim: “Amazingly, CNN just released a poll at 71%, saying that the economy is in the best shape since 2001, 18 years! WOW, is CNN becoming a believer?”
pageContext.analysis: Trump ignores the fact that the same poll found that Trump's approval rating was 42 percent, which at this point in his presidency puts him near the bottom of the list of modern elected presidents, between President Bill Clinton in 1995 (44%) and President Ronald Reagan in 1983 (41%). The CNN poll on whether economic conditions are good does not go back to 1995, but an equivalent Gallup poll (in which 53 percent rated the economy as excellent or good) in 1995 found that just 29 percent rated the economy that highly. So Clinton had an even higher approval rating under more difficult economic conditions.
